Family Counselling Service Practice Manager

Company Name Victorian Aboriginal Health Service Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 7 days ago Number of views 11 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About the Opportunity


VAHS\xa0now has a rewarding opportunity for a Family Counselling Service Practice Manager\xa0to join the Family Counselling Service (FCS)\xa0team on a full-time basis, in Melbourne, VIC.


Reporting to the Family Counselling Manager and the Clinical Director, the FCS Practice Manager is responsible for ensuring consistency with VAHS philosophy, policies and best practice standards in the efficient operations of the Family Counselling Clinic.


As the FCS Practice Manager, your day-to-day responsibilities will include (but not be limited to):


  • Liaising with the Family Counselling Manager, Clinical Coordinator and Clinical Director to improve systems, processes and structures so that policies and procedures are developed, documented and implemented;
  • Overseeing patient bookings, the Clinic roster and room allocation to ensure adequate staff coverage to provide services;
  • Maintaining a financially viable practice and an efficient, effective and safe working environment working towards a self-sustaining practice based on Medicare billings;
  • Increasing effective communication between staff and other areas of the service by convening, attending and participating in general and unit staff meetings;
  • Ensuring the correct and appropriate use of MBS items numbers through the provision of education to medical and reception staff; and
  • Leading and implementing policies and procedures within the clinic to ensure all relevant accreditation standards are met.

About the Benefits


This role will see you taking charge of a multidisciplinary team improving social and emotional wellbeing outcomes throughout the wider Aboriginal community.


In return for your hard work and dedication, VAHS\xa0is offering the successful candidate a\xa0competitive remuneration package circa $100,000-$110,000 inclusive of super, negotiable with skills and experience.\xa0Not-for-profit salary sacrificing options are also available to further increase your take-home pay.


You will be joining a collaborative and friendly team who will support you in your onboarding process so you can hit the ground running, and the organisation also encourages ongoing training and development for all employees.


This opportunity won't last long - if you have a background in family counselling or similar and want to help make a difference to the lives of Aboriginal people in Victoria, don't wait - Apply Now!

Mid-Senior level

Job description

Sales Manager / Business Development Manager (Melbourne)

This is a senior position, responsible for driving volume growth, identifying new opportunities and managing multiple stakeholders, while always operating within Macquarie’s compliance framework. As part of the broader Broker Sales business your efforts will contribute significantly to the team’s overall financial results.

As our Sales Manager/Business Development Manager, you will be responsible for acquiring third party Finance Introducers and growing related volumes in the Victoria asset finance segment including motor vehicle, plant & equipment and rental.

Key responsibilities will see you manage portfolio profitability; own and deliver assigned projects, new policies and processes relating to Broker Sales and the broader Introducer Sales Team as well as maintain a strong understanding of the asset finance industry, including the ongoing impacts of regulation, technology and changes in market structure.

To be successful in this role, you will have considerable experience in either asset or commercial finance. Ideally, this experience will include both sales and credit management within a large Financial Services business. You will demonstrate the ability to operate successfully in a fast moving and outcome-driven environment, along with the passion and enthusiasm to drive team success and deliver against growth targets. A tertiary qualification in a finance related discipline is also preferred.

To submit an application, please apply via the 'apply' link or if you may have questions please contact Melissa Liekens on Melissa.Liekens@Macquarie.com

With Offices In Australia, New Zealand, Asia, North America And Europe, Corporate And Asset Finance Specialises In

Corporate and Asset Finance Group provides innovative and traditional capital, finance and related services to clients operating in selected international markets.
  • leasing and asset finance
  • tailored debt and finance solutions
  • Asset remarketing, sourcing and trading.

Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

Job description

Our Organisation

Melbourne Water is a significant business. We manage water supply catchments, sewage, along with rivers, creeks and major drainage systems. This role within the Information Technology Team will provide you with the opportunity to make a difference and contribute to a positive work environment; one where people can learn and perform to their full potential and are committed to our vision of enhancing life and liveability.


The Role

As the Agile Business Analyst you will elicit and defines requirements and functionality using Agile techniques and methods within the Scrum Delivery teams such as epics, stories, tasks and acceptance criteria using best practice techniques.


We aim to make roles flexible, and whilst roles are advertised as fulltime we will consider requests for flexible work arrangements, including part time and job share.


Your Skills and Experience
  • Extensive experience in Agile and Scrum delivery teams in the role of Agile Business Analyst\xa0
  • Extensive experience in Business Analysis using various analysis tools and techniques on software development projects
  • Experience in delivering complex Business Process Management applications using Business Process Management Platforms (e.g. Pega, Appian etc.)
  • Demonstrable skills working in multiple domains such as BI, Mobility, PEGA etc.
  • Relevant Agile, Business Analyst, Pega certifications (desirable)

Your ability to establish and maintain collaborative working relationships with internal and external stakeholders is required together with a qualification in Information Technology.


For more information, please see the attached Position Description:\xa0Position Description - Agile Business Analyst (1).pdf


Working at Melbourne Water

Working at Melbourne Water, you will be part of a talented, passionate team dedicated to enhancing liveability in Melbourne and beyond. You’ll do truly meaningful work in a supportive, constructive culture that encourages you to make the most of your individual talents.


We provide a range of initiatives and benefits to make help our people thrive professionally and personally.


Flexible Working

Melbourne Water is committed to flexible working, offering a variety of flexible arrangements to suit you and us, understanding that it brings with it customer and business benefits as well as helping individual employees achieve a good work–life fit.


Diversity

Diversity is important to Melbourne Water. We encourage applications from mature age workers, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disability and people from diverse cultural backgrounds.


How to apply

Click on the "apply" button and complete the online application form.

Chief of Private Funding

Company Name World Vision Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 94 views

Job description

A little about the high performing team at World Vision Australia Business:

An exceptional opportunity has arisen for an experienced talent to join our high performing executive leadership team to set the future strategic direction of the Private Funding team via the adoption of strategies with a supporter centric philosophy to ensure a diverse and sustainable revenue portfolio to support our mission.

\xa0

Reporting to the CEO, this role provides leadership and strategic direction for the team with the intent of securing relationships and funds for the organisation and establishing partnerships in the corporate sector, major donors and church segments. Furthermore, the role will promote and grow revenue through donations, wills, bequests, foundation, cause marketing and other forms of partnership.

The successful applicant will possess a track record of achievements and capabilities, including and not limited to:

  • Strong sales and relationship skills
  • Proven experience growing sales revenue and business development
  • Leading organisational transformation and leading high performing businesses
  • Outstanding collaborative leadership skills, internally and externally of an organisation
  • Collaborate at all levels of the organisation and cross-functionally
  • Achieve results through others to deliver organisational outcomes
  • Engage, influence, lead and grow others through forming strong relationships, networks and partnerships
  • Proven experience leading effective teams, providing vision, direction and demonstrating strong commercial acumen
  • Develop the organisation for the future by driving change, innovation and building capability for competitive advantage
  • Understanding of financial markets would be advantageous

What Success Looks Like?

The Private Funding business at World Vision Australia is strong and has valuable growth opportunity to deeply engage new and existing donors for our incredible purpose.

The role ensures that financial and non-financial targets are achieved for World Vision Australia across the areas of major & middle donors, trusts, foundations, wills and bequests and provides leadership to teams that manage relationships, income generation and advocacy activity within the Church, Corporate segments and High Net Worth Individuals.

You excel working in an ever-changing environment and you love forming strong relationships, which let you effectively engage with stakeholders and to perform at peak. You are a subject matter expert and can collaborate and influence with senior stakeholders to deliver the desired organisational outcome.

\xa0

Having a proactive and fresh approach, you can overcome any obstacles that may come your way and bring your experience of building and transferring revenue channels to bear. In addition, your energy is infectious, showcasing the passion you can bring to our organisation.

\xa0

Why Should You Apply?

  • We collaborate in a high performing and professional culture, committed to one common goal; the fight against global poverty, its causes and making a real difference in the world
  • We build brighter futures for vulnerable children and seeking to empower the world's poorest people.
  • Our people have access to professional development programs that include on-the-job learning, e-learning, workshops, forums, leadership development and internal mobility
  • We challenge vertical thinking and ask for horizontal perspective and implications
  • We believe in timely truth telling that seeks to understand as well as be understood, our conversation is always full of grace and authenticity
  • We have the scale and impact to engage those with wealth to have a brilliant and positive impact on challenges of poverty
  • Together, we achieve organisational outcomes
  • Competitive salary and flexible salary packaging scheme

Real Estate Senior Lawyer/Senior Associate

Company Name Ashurst Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 7 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Description

 About Ashurst:

Ashurst is a leading global law firm with a history spanning almost 200 years, and clear strategy for our future growth. Our in-depth understanding of our clients and commitment to providing exceptional standards of service have seen us become a trusted adviser to local and global corporates, financial institutions and governments in all areas of commercial law. To find out more please visit here .

The Opportunity

We are looking for a Senior Lawyer/junior Senior Associate to join our Real Estate team in Melbourne. The real estate work is for a strong and varied client base and includes work on real estate around Australia.

Ashurst is recognised as being one of the leading firms in the real estate area offering clients an integrated team operating at the heart of the real estate sector on a global scale. We act as a bridge between legal cultures and advise on highly complex transactions both domestically and across multiple jurisdictions.

Ashurst combines the benefits of a leading real estate practice with a supportive and collegiate environment. The firm is looking to make a long term investment in a strong lawyer who is similarly looking to make a long term career commitment to our real estate practice. Ashurst has a proven track record in developing lawyers and the vacancy represents an outstanding opportunity for a team-player with strong technical skills and a commercial approach.

Recent Work Includes
  • Melbourne City Council: Acting on the acquisition and development of a major CBD property as part of the redevelopment of Melbourne's Queen Victoria Market site
  • Australian Unity Healthcare Property Trust: Acting in relation to the Trust's investment in Brisbane's Herston Quarter development;
  • Commonwealth of Australia: Acting on property divestment programs and on the transfer of land to a State to create a national park;
  • Toll: Acting for major logistics company on its real estate;
  • Airservices Australia: Acting in respect of its national property portfolio;


A full job description including a breakdown of responsibilities can be found attached to the role on our careers page .

To Succeed In This Role You Will Need

Desired Skills and Experience:
  • A minimum of 3-4 years' experience, including real estate experience, gained within a firm with a strong real estate practice or in-house
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Strong drafting ability
  • A commercial approach and an ability to negotiate effectively
  • Strong attention to detail with well-developed analytical skills
  • The ability to be team-focused and also work independently, taking a proactive, positive and energetic approach with a commitment to providing excellent service and a desire to interact with the market and build client relationships.


At Ashurst, you'll have the opportunity to work in an environment that encourages learning and excellence with a highly professional global team. You will also have a range of social, sporting and health benefits available to you.

Job description


This is an excellent opportunity to join a top 100 ASX listed business as they continue to grow through a combination of organic growth and astute strategic acquisitions. A market leader in their field, this business enjoys a nationwide footprint and provides a wide range of services to varied sectors and business sizes. Joining a highly regarded group accounting function, you will report to a strong management team, and fulfil a role that is both technically challenging and commercially involved with various business units.


Key responsibilities:-

  • Provide support to the Group reporting team in the preparation and execution of monthly consolidation processes
  • Provide technical accounting assistance to a range of stakeholders
  • Assist with the compilation and delivery of the Group's statutory reporting requirements in a timely fashion, for full year and half year processes
  • Provide direction in the implementation of new accounting standards and requirements
  • Prepare group reconciliations, including roll-forward of balance sheet accounts as required
  • Assist with governance processes around financial reporting, and taking ownership for regular financial stewardship reviews
  • Ensure that major transactions in the Group are accounted for in accordance with agreed outcomes
  • Respond to a range of issues arising at business unit level, providing technical and commercial guidance to internal stakeholders and business unit finance teams


Key requirements:-

  • CA/CPA qualified and with a Big 4 training, as a 'second mover' you have built a track record in the preparation of consolidated financial statements in a listed business
  • You possess a sound understanding of accounting standards and the application thereof
  • You enjoy showcasing your technical accounting skills, which are aligned with a strong sense of commercial acumen
  • A team player, you are comfortable working in a lean environment where you are expected to play a hands-on role
  • Strong ERP systems skills, with exposure to TM1, Cognos or Navision being a distinct advantage


Desired Skills and Experience

This is an excellent opportunity to join a top 100 ASX listed business as they continue to grow through a combination of organic growth and astute strategic acquisitions.
